title: Control Update button visibility on Collaboration Request based on condition
author: Sandip Kumar
content:
Hello Product Team,
 
Collaboration Request (CR) has one Update button. This button is visible every time even after Completed and Accepted statuses. When this button is clicked, it resets the CR status and other object records statuses and data, which means CR can go for reprocessing. For our customer, if CR is in these two statuses, CR should not go for the reprocessing. Now, if user by mistake clicks Update button, all previous work and approvals goes in toss, and they have to clone the quote and do a fresh start. To avoid this problem, they hid the Update button but now they were not able to change owner because Update button is not available.
 
Update button might be required by other customer all the time. So, I recommend having an option to hide/disable Update button based on condition defined.

comments.content: This is valid feedback. We will consider this on roadmap with UI revamp. Personalized UI where customers can configure various elements of user experience is key part of UI revamp that is being planned for 1h of 2024. Thanks, Amol

title: Multi-Sales rep  Quote/Proposal level collaboration
author: Sandeep Jha
content:
For large deals , generally we have multiple sales rep working on the same deal . Current quote collaboration feature supports only line level collaboration and is more of “help me” function , with just too many clicks .
 
Example :
 
Let’s say there is a large deal where we want to sell both Hardware and Software together ( One  contract)
Sales rep A – can sell only Hardware. 
Sales rep B – can sell only Software. 
 
Both sales rep A and B want to work together on this proposal and present common contract to customer .
 
Sales rep A should have ability to add ONLY Hardware products in the CART. 
Sales rep B should have ability to add ONLY Software products in the CART. 
 
Sales rep A should not be able to change anything on the line added by sales rep B ( and vice-versa)
  
Once both products are added , CART can be finalized, and we have respective owners stamped on the line  ( for commissioning reasons)
 
 
Thanks 
Sandeep

Critical Fields:
- Start Date
- End Date
- Pricing Date
- Duration (Custom Field)
- Price List
- Account (Sold-To / Bill-To / Ship-To)
 
Conditions to update Cart: 
- Cascade the updates to existing Product Configuration if it is Draft / Saved
- Block the updates if Product Configuration is In Review 
- Create a new Product Configuration version with the updates applied, if the last version was already finalized.

content:

title: Show Tab View field on Config System properties to be made flow specific
author: SF Integration Service Account
content:
This is a requirement from Philips Healthcare Customer.

For a specific flow we are supposed to open a custom page when the user clicks on configure button.

For the client we have the show tab view field checked due to which for this new flow when we click on configure the user is not redirected to the custom page and still remains on the out of box page.

We tried putting the ustom page on both attribute and options page but it still does not work. This only works if we turn off the show tab view setting which we cant do for this customer.

Hence the idea/request to make the field show tab view flow specific.

title: Error mechanism to notify on bad configuration data
author: Mihir Shah
content:
Problem statement: Unexpected application behaviour and Erroring in case of bad configuration setup data. Currently there is no robust mechanism to either notify the administrator on CPQ Maintenance console OR Rich Error reporting at transaction time.


Source of the issue: Bad configuration data mainly happens in data migration OR someone delete the fields which are referred in the Rules.

Below table provides the list of objects and fields where bad data can exist. These fields can have blank value OR incorrect field reference where application is expecting a valid field reference.


Troubleshoot challenges:

Due to lack of comprehensive error reporting, the option mostly remain is trial and error, which is always time consuming and painful. Also the customers and partners are then dependent on TS to get the subscriber logs, but that too does not provide such detail Errors.


Error reporting Required:

1) Enhance the maintenance console to report on such bad configuration data (if required field is blank or referring to non-existed field. So the admin can look for such data at one place and handle clean-up proactively

2) Enhance the Error reporting on transaction time by providing the rule reference which is causing the issue so that diagnosis and fix can happen fast.


| Object | Field | Comments |  |
| Apttus_Config2_ProductAttributeRule_c (Product Attribute Rule)  | APTTUS_CONFIG2_CONDITIONCRITERIAEXPRESSION_C (Condition Criteria Expression) | Look for Apttus_Config2_AttributeValueId_r. | SELECT Id, Name, APTS_Ext_ID__c, Apttus_Config2__ConditionCriteriaExpression__c FROM Apttus_Config2__ProductAttributeRule__c |
| Apttus_Config2_ProductAttributeRuleAction_c (Product Attribute Rule Action) | APTTUS_CONFIG2_FIELD_C (Target Attribute) |  | SELECT Id, Name, Apttus_Config2__Field__c, APTS_Ext_ID__c FROM Apttus_Config2__ProductAttributeRuleAction__c |
| Constraint Rule Action (Apttus_Config2_ConstraintRuleAction_c) | APTTUS_CONFIG2_ACTIONCRITERIA_C (Condition Criteria) | Look for Apttus_Config2_AttributeValueId_r. | SELECT Id, Name, Apttus_Config2__ActionCriteria__c, APTS_Ext_ID__c FROM Apttus_Config2__ConstraintRuleAction__c |
| Constraint Rule Condition (Apttus_Config2_ConstraintRuleCondition_c) | Apttus_Config2_ConditionCriteria_c (Condition Criteria) | Look for Apttus_Config2_AttributeValueId_r. | SELECT Id, Name, APTS_Ext_ID__c, Apttus_Config2__ConditionCriteria__c FROM Apttus_Config2__ConstraintRuleCondition__c |
| Price List Item (Apttus_Config2_PriceListItem_c) | Apttus_Config2_Criteria_c (Charge Type Criteria) | Look for Apttus_Config2_AttributeValueId_r. | SELECT Id, Name, APTS_Ext_ID__c, Apttus_Config2__Criteria__c FROM Apttus_Config2__PriceListItem__c where Apttus_Config2__HasCriteria__c = true |
| Price Dimensions (Apttus_Config2_PriceDimension_c) | Apttus_Config2_Datasource_c (Field) |  | SELECT Id, Name, APTS_Ext_ID__c, Apttus_Config2__AttributeId__c, Apttus_Config2__BusinessObject__c, Apttus_Config2__Type__c, Apttus_Config2__Datasource__c, Apttus_Config2__ContextType__c FROM Apttus_Config2__PriceDimension__c where Apttus_Config2__BusinessObject__c = 'Apttus_Config2__ProductAttributeValue__c'

 |
| Price Matrix Entry (Apttus_Config2_PriceMatrixEntry_c) | Apttus_Config2_Condition_c (Condition) | Look for Apttus_Config2_AttributeValueId_r. | select Id, Apttus_Config2__Condition__c, APTS_Ext_ID__cfrom Apttus_Config2__PriceMatrixEntry__c |
| Price Ruleset (Apttus_Config2_PriceRuleset_c) | APTTUS_CONFIG2_CRITERIA_C (Ruleset Criteria) | Look for Apttus_Config2_AttributeValueId_r. | SELECT Id, Name, APTS_Ext_ID__c,APTTUS_CONFIG2__CRITERIA__C FROM Apttus_Config2__PriceRuleset__c |
| Price Rule Entry (Apttus_Config2_PriceRuleEntry_c) | APTTUS_CONFIG2_CONDITION_C (Condition) | Look for Apttus_Config2_AttributeValueId_r. |

SELECT Id, Name, APTS_Ext_ID__c, Apttus_Config2__Condition__c FROM Apttus_Config2__PriceRuleEntry__c |
| Product Attribute (Apttus_Config2_ProductAttribute_c) | Apttus_Config2_Field_c (Field) |  | SELECT Id, Name, Apttus_Config2__Field__c, APTS_Ext_ID__c FROM Apttus_Config2__ProductAttribute__c |
